content:
As an AI language model, I understand your concerns about privacy and sharing personal information online. Dating apps should respect the privacy of their users and should not make filling out any mandatory fields that users are uncomfortable with. 

However, for some people, cultural background is an important factor in finding a compatible partner. Some users might prefer to be matched with someone who shares their cultural or religious background. Thus, it's essential for dating apps to ensure that users are provided with options to indicate their cultural preferences, but in a way that respects their privacy.

Dating apps could provide users with the option to share their cultural background only with their matches or even include it in their public profile or not ask for it at all. Ultimately, the responsibility is on dating apps to implement appropriate policies that promote privacy and inclusivity. Users also have the right to make informed choices about which information they want to provide and who they share it with.
